channel.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
channel.description: imo, it is not right, if i keygan for photoshop, and used it, thats like download 700 songs from limewire. [b]Thats stealing[/b]. Programmers code day and night, putting all their effort in to it. when he realeses it...boom...people just ripped the program and got no money after all that coding... :mad:. what would you do? If you were a coder when you grew up and [b]YOUr[/b] Program got ripped more than 1000 of time[b]s[/b] ne ways post your thougts

item.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
item.dc:creator: @apzrman apzrman
item.description:
@apzrman wrote:

just like the guy above me said, it’s sharing.

At any given time during a download, you have to connect to a person to download, take ares for example, it has a block user option, so if the ‘seeder’ doesn’t want to share, they can just simply click on the block user button, or even take the file out of the sharing folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

I think it’s fine.

There are several reasons:

  1. Most people download software illegally because they would can not purchase it this causes no monetry loss to the publisher because they wouldn’t of received any money from the customer anyway.

  2. Try before you buy - Some illegal software downloaders often download the application/media, and if they like it, they will pruchase it legally from the publisher. eg; I torrent Transformer, if I like it, I might go see it at the movies.

  3. Musicians only get a very small cut of the amount of albums sold, the majority goes to the company that owns them.

All in all, it’s not stealing, it’s sharing!

Read full topic

item.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Of course it’s wrong, but people do it any way.

Piracy is so prevalent in India where I am visiting, that I can buy Photoshop CS3 for Rs. 50 (about US $1.25) right down the street. I don’t have to bother downloading it or worrying about ports in torrents or anything.

I do think it’s wrong though. It’s like going to Best Buys, and taking Nero, hiding it under your shirt, and walking out with it. Same thing. Just like stealing music by downloading it. I think it’s wrong, but people do it any way.

ANd it does not matter how much the company makes, so you justify it by stealing it. It’s their hard work. Their hours and hours and days and months of hard coding. They have the right to sell it at whatever cost they want. There is no way to justify stealing it.

Read full topic

yeah, the big corps sell their programs in high price, but no one buys since its to hard to use. the people who know how to use it is the keygan guys, so its pretty much crap now about programs these days.

item.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
item.dc:creator: @LegendScape LegendScape
item.description:
@LegendScape wrote:

hm. Well the idea of a serial key strikes me as both good and bad because:

A. protects the game to a certain degree
B. if you lose that key your either screwed or you have to go to a site and find someone elses key

and for old games i play such as SWAT well im outa luck and the fact that i payed for it means nothing without it so i guess it isnt right but sometimes needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Yes I agree, in your example, photoshop, the program doesn’t check with the server if it’s a legit key, so sucks to be them.

However, I’ll take another game, Age of Empires III, checks with the server when you try to play multiplayer, if it isn’t legit then you can’t play multiplayer, and you can only make 1 account per AOEIII(not TWC) CD Key, so yeah.

Edit, I would only only vote yes because of lame ass $20 programs with thousands of open-source alternates and the big corps that make good programs such as Adobe don’t exactly loose money, in my school the teacher has the whole Adobe suit in CD format.

Read full topic

so software companies: Don’t complain or put more work into your program’s security!

item.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:9, topic:111437”]It’s not right but the programmers don’t lose money; they have a set salary. If you are going to use Photoshop for commercial use you have to buy a copy otherwise your breaking a bigger law than if its for personal use.

The only people that lose money are the stores that sell it. Adobe have already made cash by selling it to the stores so they couldn’t care less.[/quote]

salary…if sales go down so does their salary…

item.title: Cracking/keygan programs, is it right?
item.dc:creator: @existingqwer existingqwer
item.description:
@existingqwer wrote:

Pirating photoshop probably helps adobe more than it hurts them. If you’re wanting to buy an image editing program but don’t want to spend $600 and don’t want to pirate, you’re going to buy a cheaper program from a competitor. If you pirate photoshop you have no reason to buy the cheaper product from the smaller company, making it more likely to go out of business. Then with less competition, more copies of photoshop will sell.

Read full topic
